articles.headline: MP urges tighter regulation after leaving X
articles.author: Grace Oakins
articles.classification_reasoning: This is a policy/regulation story about AI regulation and social media platform oversight. It requires institutional and expert context about technology policy, platform regulation, and societal impacts. While personal experience (MP's decision to leave X) is present, the story is fundamentally about regulatory responses to AI technology.

beat_context.beat_reasoning: Technology/regulation beat. While the specific incident involves gendered harm (AI undressing images), the beat itself (tech policy/regulation) is typically gender-neutral. Both men and women are technology policy experts and politicians.

quoted_sources.name: Vikki Slade
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Slade is the central figure whose personal experience (leaving X) drives this story. She is not replaceable - this story exists because of her specific action and perspective as an MP who experienced harm on the platform. Her lived experience of 'derogatory comments' and 'vile' responses makes her an impact source, not a structural expert who could be swapped out.
quoted_sources.title: MP for Mid Dorset and North Poole
quoted_sources.quote_context: Primary subject discussing her decision to leave X due to derogatory comments and concerns about Grok AI feature

quoted_sources.name: Dr Amy Tatum
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Tatum provides expert analysis about misogyny on social media and women's representation. She is an academic expert who could be replaced by another communications scholar or social media researcher. The story needs expert commentary on the broader implications, but it doesn't require Tatum specifically - any qualified expert on digital misogyny could fulfill this role.
quoted_sources.title: Communication and Media Lecturer
quoted_sources.quote_context: Provides expert commentary on misogyny on X and concerns about women closing social media spaces

stakeholder_groups.group: Social media users (particularly women experiencing harassment)

stakeholder_groups.quoted_source: Vikki Slade (as MP advocating for regulation)

stakeholder_groups.group: Social media platform companies (X/Twitter, Elon Musk)

articles.headline: Profile pictures turn purple in support of South African Women
articles.author: Tyler Tamou
articles.classification_reasoning: This is a story about social media activism, news media practices, and how information spreads. While it includes personal experience from a shop owner, the story requires institutional context about journalism, news organizations (BBC, Reuters), and social media's role in news dissemination. The focus is on structural questions about media ecosystems rather than individual lived experiences.

beat_context.beat_reasoning: This covers media/journalism beat and social media/technology beat. While the underlying issue is gender-based violence, the beat being covered is news media practices and social media activism, which are gender-neutral beats. Both men and women work as journalists, media producers, and social media analysts.

quoted_sources.name: Madison Love
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Love is sharing her lived experience as a member of the South African diaspora community in Dorset who organized a fundraiser. Her connection to the South African community and her personal observations about social media versus news coverage make her perspective specific and non-replaceable. She represents the community experiencing and responding to the issue, not an expert who could be swapped out.
quoted_sources.title: Owner
quoted_sources.quote_context: Community member who hosted fundraiser for Women's shutdown, discussing social media awareness versus traditional news coverage

quoted_sources.name: Helena Fremantle
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Fremantle provides institutional perspective from BBC on how news organizations track and respond to social media trends. She represents BBC as an organization and could be replaced by another BBC producer or news professional. The story needs BBC's perspective, but it doesn't require Fremantle specifically.
quoted_sources.title: Assistant Producer
quoted_sources.quote_context: Discussing BBC's monitoring of social media and news selection processes

quoted_sources.name: Patricia Leon Elias
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Leon Elias provides expert institutional perspective from Reuters on how news organizations balance speed and accuracy when social media surfaces stories. She represents Reuters' editorial approach and could be replaced by another Reuters editor or senior news professional. The story needs a major news agency perspective, but not specifically her.
quoted_sources.title: Senior Manager
quoted_sources.quote_context: Explaining how Reuters evaluates social media signals and prioritizes accuracy over speed
